content.description: The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 8 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 6 to 8 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from top to bottom:
content.question: The curve enters the window at (0.4 comma 8.5). The curve decreases from right to left, passing through point A at (negative 1 comma 6.7) and gradually becoming vertical at (negative 1.7 comma 4.5). The curve decreases from left to right, passing through point B at (negative 1 comma 2.2). The curve continues to decrease from left to right, passing through (0 comma 1.7) and (2 comma 0.9). When the curve reaches the point (2.9 comma 0), it is vertical and changes directions, decreasing from right to left. When the curve reaches the point (2.4 comma negative 1.3), it is vertical and changes directions, decreasing from left to right. The curve passes through (3 comma negative 2.4), (5 comma negative 3.9), and exits the window at (8.5 comma negative 5.9). In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the graph of an implicitly defined function curve is given along with the two labeled points <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math>. Which of the following describes the curve?

choices.label: For pairs of points near <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math>, the ratio of the change in <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> and the change in <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> is positive, and the values of both variables simultaneously increase or simultaneously decrease.

For pairs of points near <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math>, the ratio of the change in <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> and the change in <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> is negative, and the values of both variables simultaneously increase or simultaneously decrease.

For pairs of points near <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math>, the ratio of the change in <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> and the change in <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> is positive, and the values of both variables simultaneously increase or simultaneously decrease.

For pairs of points near <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math>, the ratio of the change in <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> and the change in <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> is negative, and the values of both variables simultaneously increase or simultaneously decrease.

content.answer: For pairs of points near <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math>, the ratio of the change in <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> and the change in <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math> is positive, and the values of both variables simultaneously increase or simultaneously decrease.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
